titlestmt.titleproper: A. F. Bayfield letter file related to the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company 1918-1919
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: A. F. Bayfield letter file related to the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Delaware, Lehigh, Schuylkill, and Susquehanna Railroad Company was incorporated in 1843, and changed its name to the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company in 1853. Known as the Route of the of the Black Diamond, the line was primarily constructed for the purpose of hauling coal.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a letter file for the years 1918-1919 of A.F. Bayfield, the auditor for the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
